member.summary: Specifies a property, event and method that indexed controls need to implement.

member.name: T:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.IDialogControlHost
member.summary: Indicates that the implementing class is a dialog that can host customizable dialog controls (subclasses of DialogControl).

member.name: T:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButton
member.summary: Identifies one of the standard buttons that can be displayed via TaskDialog.

member.name: T:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons
member.summary: Provides standard combinations of standard buttons in the TaskDialog.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.None
member.summary: No buttons.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.Cancel
member.summary: A button labeled "Cancel".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.Ok
member.summary: A button labeled "Ok".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.OkClose
member.summary: Two buttons labeled "Ok" and "Close".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.OkCancel
member.summary: Two buttons labeled "Ok" and "Cancel".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.OkCancelRetry
member.summary: Three buttons labeled "Ok", "Retry", and "Cancel".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.Yes
member.summary: A button labeled "Yes".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.YesNo
member.summary: Two buttons labeled "Yes" and "No".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.YesNoCancel
member.summary: Three buttons labeled "Yes", "No", and "Cancel.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.RetryCancel
member.summary: Two buttons labeled "Retry" and "Cancel".

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardButtons.Close
member.summary: A single button labeled "Close".

member.name: T:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardIcon
member.summary: Specifies the icon displayed in a task dialog.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardIcon.Warning
member.summary: Displays the warning icon.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardIcon.Error
member.summary: Displays the error icon.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardIcon.Information
member.summary: Displays the Information icon.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.TaskDialogStandardIcon.SecurityShieldUserAccount
member.summary: Displays the User Account Control shield.

member.name: T:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities
member.summary: Specifies the redirection capabilities for known folders.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities.None
member.summary: Redirection capability is unknown.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities.AllowAll
member.summary: The known folder can be redirected.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities.Redirectable
member.summary: The known folder can be redirected. Currently, redirection exists only for common and user folders; fixed and virtual folders cannot be redirected.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities.DenyAll
member.summary: Redirection is not allowed.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities.DenyPolicyRedirected
member.summary: The folder cannot be redirected because it is already redirected by group policy.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities.DenyPolicy
member.summary: The folder cannot be redirected because the policy prohibits redirecting this folder.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.RedirectionCapabilities.DenyPermissions
member.summary: The folder cannot be redirected because the calling application does not have sufficient permissions.

member.name: T:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.DefinitionOptions
member.summary: Specifies behaviors for known folders.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.DefinitionOptions.None
member.summary: No behaviors are defined.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.DefinitionOptions.LocalRedirectOnly
member.summary: Prevents a per-user known folder from being redirected to a network location.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.DefinitionOptions.Roamable
member.summary: The known folder can be roamed through PC-to-PC synchronization.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.DefinitionOptions.Precreate
member.summary: Creates the known folder when the user first logs on.

member.name: T:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.FolderCategory
member.summary: Specifies the categories for known folders.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.FolderCategory.None
member.summary: The folder category is not specified.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.FolderCategory.Virtual
member.summary: The folder is a virtual folder. Virtual folders are not part of the file system. For example, Control Panel and Printers are virtual folders. A number of properties such as folder path and redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.FolderCategory.Fixed
member.summary: The folder is fixed. Fixed file system folders are not managed by the Shell and are usually given a permanent path when the system is installed. For example, the Windows and Program Files folders are fixed folders. A number of properties such as redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.FolderCategory.Common
member.summary: The folder is a common folder. Common folders are used for sharing data and settings accessible by all users of a system. For example, all users share a common Documents folder as well as their per-user Documents folder.

member.name: F:IPS.Library.Dialogs.Contracts.FolderCategory.PerUser
member.summary: Each user has their own copy of the folder. Per-user folders are those stored under each user's profile and accessible only by that user.
